page.title: 02Canvey and the refinery.
page.content: The area we hace surveyed has a large road running through the middle of it,called Northwick Road.It is a quiet road that leads to the oil storage tankers.On the left of the road there is a wide spread of grass with a couple of small bushes.Beyond that there are large oil storage tankers. This covers about half of our surveyed plot.There are seven large main oil storage tanks and five smaller ones. Amongst these are large chimneys and small generator plants.On the other side of the oil storage tankers is the {River Thames}this borders {Canvey} on one side.These storage tankers are not in use,this is because of an{I.R.A.} bomb in 1977 at the nearby Texaco oil storage company at Stanford-le-Hope. Public outcry prevented the completion of this terminal, as they were afraid that they might become a target.
